author: Reuters Editorial
title: Initial bids for Air India stake sale in next couple of weeks: official
text:
(Reuters) - India will invite initial bids for a stake sale in state-run carrier Air India in the next couple of weeks, Civil Aviation Secretary Rajiv Choubey said on Thursday in a speech at an airshow in the southern Indian city of Hyderabad.
FILE PHOTO - An Air India Airbus A320neo plane takes off in Colomiers near Toulouse, France, December 13, 2017. REUTERS/Regis Duvignau Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s cabinet gave the go-ahead last year to sell Air India, after successive governments spent billions of dollars in recent years to keep it going. However, it has yet to decide on what to do with the carrier’s debt burden of $8.5 billion.
Reporting by Jessica Kuruthukulangara in Bengaluru; Editing by Biju Dwarakanath
